<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/28/apple-keeps-momentum-going-strong-quarter?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
How Much More Can a $1.4 Trillion Company Grow?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A sliver apple logo with a bite taken out of it " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwMjU0OTcyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Heading into earnings yesterday, momentum was already in Apple's favor: Shares were up 30% since its last report and over 100% from a year ago. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Unlike <em>The Morning Show</em>, Apple didn't disappoint. Fiscal Q1 revenue <a href="https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2020/01/apple-reports-record-first-quarter-results/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rose 9% annually</a> to $91.8 billion—beating most expectations by $3+ billion. Let's dig in. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The goods </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">CEO Tim Cook pointed to strong performances from iPhone 11s and the Wearables, Home, and Accessories division, which did $10+ billion in quarterly sales for the first time ever. If those numbers are so big to the point of abstraction, here's another: Apple passed 1.5 billion active devices globally. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wearables specifically were up 44%, <a href="https://appleinsider.com/articles/20/01/28/notes-of-interest-from-apples-q1-2020-holiday-earnings-report-and-conference-call?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Cook said</a>, and over 75% of Apple Watch buyers were first-timers. But the product du jour was AirPods, which Apple can’t make enough of to satisfy demand.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The company didn't disclose numbers, but one analyst estimates AirPods did </span><span><a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/apple-iphone-sales-return-growth-213000077.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">as much as $4 billion</a></span><span> in Q1. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Apple is king <em>and</em> queen of the <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2019/12/11/worldwide-wearable-shipments-doubled-q3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wearables market.</a> </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">And the services?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Cook's been <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/08/apple-services-notches-record-year?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">refocusing Apple on services</a>, including subscription video, gaming, and payments. Last quarter, the division took in $12.7 billion—a 17% year-over-year increase. The highlights: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Apple has 418+ million paid subscriptions across its platforms and expects half a billion come March.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Apple Pay revenue and transactions more than doubled annually.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Executives said they're using subscriber totals to judge Apple TV+'s success…but stopped short of handing over those digits. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">And China</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Revenue from Greater China, Apple's second-most important market, rose 3% annually to $13.6 billion. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>About a year ago, Apple </span><span><a href="https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2019/01/letter-from-tim-cook-to-apple-investors/?mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cut</a></span><span> its sales forecast over fears of lower iPhone demand among Chinese consumers. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But yesterday, Cook said iPhone revenue grew by double-digits on the mainland in Q1.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Apple is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/28/tim-cook-says-apple-shuts-one-store-in-china-restricts-travel-due-to-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">closely monitoring</a> the coronavirus outbreak, which could hurt sales during the Lunar New Year and impact some of its production as plants remain closed around the country. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TELECOM
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/28/uk-include-chinese-giant-huawei-upcoming-5g-network?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Brits Drive on the Other Side of the Huawei
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwMjQ2MjUyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Daniel Leal-Olivas/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-britain-usa-huawei/defying-trump-uks-johnson-refuses-to-ban-huawei-from-5g-idUSKBN1ZR02G?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> his country would not bar equipment from Chinese telecom giant Huawei in its new 5G mobile network. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The statement was a major rebuke to President Trump, who wants to prevent Huawei gear from being deployed around the globe. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Johnson didn’t give Huawei free rein.</strong> Its involvement in the 5G network <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-k-allows-huawei-to-build-parts-of-5g-network-11580213316?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will be capped</a> at 35% (roughly its share of Britain’s non-core 4G network). Huawei will also be locked out of the U.K.'s core network as well as sensitive sites like nuclear facilities and military bases. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> More countries are <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/technology/britain-huawei-5G.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">getting caught</a> in the U.S.-China crossfire. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The U.S. insists Huawei equipment represents a national security threat. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But it’s hard for even American allies to turn down Huawei’s affordable prices and reach. It’s the global leader in telecom equipment, thanks in part to </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-the-journal-calculated-huaweis-state-support-11577280830?mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">generous subsidies</a></span><span> from the Chinese government. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> This is one of the U.K.’s “biggest public breaks with Washington in decades,” writes Reuters.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/28/nyu-prof-proposes-inheritance-tax-new-paper?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Always Be Polite to Grandfather
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Scene from the HBO show Succession" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/xkGcYaA7MvdMSZR6pv/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Scene from the HBO show Succession" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/xkGcYaA7MvdMSZR6pv/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you listen closely, you can hear the Sazeracs clinking. Americans <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-28/americans-will-inherit-764-billion-this-year-mostly-tax-free?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will inherit</a> $764 billion this year, according to a new <a href="https://www.hamiltonproject.org/papers/leveling_the_playing_field_between_inherited_income_and_income_from_work_through_an_inheritance_tax?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">paper</a> by NYU law professor Lily Batchelder. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The paper estimates Americans will pay an average tax of 2.1% on that bounty. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>That’s less than a seventh of what Americans pay in taxes on work and savings—an estimated 15.8%. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Batchelder thinks that reflects a broken system.</strong> She wants the U.S. to ditch the loophole-happy <em>estate</em> tax, which requires Father Alistair's estate to pay taxes on its gifts to heirs. Instead, Batchelder proposes an <em>inheritance</em> tax, which is levied on young Theodore Vanderfeller III and other ultrawealthy recipients. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Tax Policy Center estimates that a tax on inheritances over $500,000 would raise $1.4 trillion over the next 10 years. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Batchelder is a former Obama adviser. The Dems are <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-07/democrats-are-finding-ways-to-tax-the-ultra-wealthy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">looking for</a> novel ways to tax the rich to fund progressive priorities.</p>

</a><span>  </span>

</a>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/28/us-budget-deficit-exceed-1-trillion-2020?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Honk if Your Budget Isn't Balanced
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Treasury Department" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTQxL3RyZWFzdXJ5X2RlcGFydG1lbnQuSlBHIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>AgnosticPreachersKid, Treasury Department WDC, CC BY 3.0</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The U.S. budget deficit will top $1 trillion this year, according to a <a href="https://www.cbo.gov/publication/56020?mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new report</a> from the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office (CBO). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What that means: </strong>The government will spend $1.02 trillion more than it collects in 2020. The widening deficit <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/01/28/us-deficit-eclipse-1-trillion-2020-cbo-says-fiscal-imbalance-continues-widen/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is a result</a> of the 2017 tax cuts and an increase in spending on federal programs.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The historical context: </strong>We haven’t seen deficits of this size during periods of low unemployment since World War II, CBO Director Phill Swagel <a href="https://www.cbo.gov/publication/56052?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a>. Public debt is projected to reach 98% of GDP by 2030—its highest percentage since 1946. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The good news: </strong>“The economy is doing well,” Swagel stressed, thanks to strong job growth and consumer spending. The CBO projects GDP will expand at a “solid rate” of 2.2% in 2020. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Which makes the current deficit more concerning; after all, deficits are supposed to <em>shrink</em> in a strong economy. Fed Chair Jerome Powell, who we’ll hear from later today, <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2019/11/13/interest-rates-powell-tells-congress-federal-debt-unsustainable/2582302001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said last year</a> “the federal budget is on an unsustainable path.” </p>

</h3>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/28/wework-phasing-free-alcohol-north-america?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">WeWork is <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/wework-cutting-free-beer-and-wine-tap-us-canada-2020-1?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">phasing out</a> free beer and wine taps at its U.S. and Canada locations, Business Insider reported Monday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While WeChairman Marcelo Claure has been on a cost-cutting charge for months, WeWork told BI this wasn’t a financial decision. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The company wants to keep tenants happy during work hours by adding a wider selection of beverages including cold brew, kombucha, seltzer, and cold teas. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>WeWork will continue to offer booze at on-site happy hours. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As former patrons of WeWork’s finest hops dispensers, we’ll be pouring one out tonight for the symbolic end of the OG WeWork era. As Bisnow <a href="https://www.bisnow.com/national/news/coworking/wework-no-more-beer-102708?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a>, “alcohol was once a pillar of WeWork’s identity, from bottomless-drink member parties to CEO Adam Neumann’s infamous penchant for shots of tequila.”</p>

style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nHow Much More Can a $1.4 Trillion Company Grow?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A sliver apple logo with a bite taken out of it \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHeading into earnings yesterday, momentum was already in Apple's favor: Shares were up 30% since its last report and over 100% from a year ago. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUnlike \u003cem\u003eThe Morning Show\u003c/em\u003e, Apple didn't disappoint. Fiscal Q1 revenue \u003ca href=\"https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2020/01/apple-reports-record-first-quarter-results/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erose 9% annually\u003c/a\u003e to $91.8 billion—beating most expectations by $3+ billion. Let's dig in. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe goods \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCEO Tim Cook pointed to strong performances from iPhone 11s and the Wearables, Home, and Accessories division, which did $10+ billion in quarterly sales for the first time ever. If those numbers are so big to the point of abstraction, here's another: Apple passed 1.5 billion active devices globally. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWearables specifically were up 44%, \u003ca href=\"https://appleinsider.com/articles/20/01/28/notes-of-interest-from-apples-q1-2020-holiday-earnings-report-and-conference-call?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCook said\u003c/a\u003e, and over 75% of Apple Watch buyers were first-timers. But the product du jour was AirPods, which Apple can’t make enough of to satisfy demand.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe company didn't disclose numbers, but one analyst estimates AirPods did \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/apple-iphone-sales-return-growth-213000077.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eas much as $4 billion\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in Q1. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eApple is king \u003cem\u003eand\u003c/em\u003e queen of the \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2019/12/11/worldwide-wearable-shipments-doubled-q3?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewearables market.\u003c/a\u003e \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAnd the services?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCook's been \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/08/apple-services-notches-record-year?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erefocusing Apple on services\u003c/a\u003e, including subscription video, gaming, and payments. Last quarter, the division took in $12.7 billion—a 17% year-over-year increase. The highlights: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eApple has 418+ million paid subscriptions across its platforms and expects half a billion come March.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eApple Pay revenue and transactions more than doubled annually.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eExecutives said they're using subscriber totals to judge Apple TV+'s success…but stopped short of handing over those digits. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAnd China\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRevenue from Greater China, Apple's second-most important market, rose 3% annually to $13.6 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAbout a year ago, Apple \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2019/01/letter-from-tim-cook-to-apple-investors/?mod=article_inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecut\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e its sales forecast over fears of lower iPhone demand among Chinese consumers. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut yesterday, Cook said iPhone revenue grew by double-digits on the mainland in Q1.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eApple is \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/28/tim-cook-says-apple-shuts-one-store-in-china-restricts-travel-due-to-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclosely monitoring\u003c/a\u003e the coronavirus outbreak, which could hurt sales during the Lunar New Year and impact some of its production as plants remain closed around the country. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-britain-usa-huawei/defying-trump-uks-johnson-refuses-to-ban-huawei-from-5g-idUSKBN1ZR02G?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e his country would not bar equipment from Chinese telecom giant Huawei in its new 5G mobile network. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe statement was a major rebuke to President Trump, who wants to prevent Huawei gear from being deployed around the globe. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eJohnson didn’t give Huawei free rein.\u003c/strong\u003e Its involvement in the 5G network \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-k-allows-huawei-to-build-parts-of-5g-network-11580213316?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill be capped\u003c/a\u003e at 35% (roughly its share of Britain’s non-core 4G network). Huawei will also be locked out of the U.K.'s core network as well as sensitive sites like nuclear facilities and military bases. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e More countries are \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/technology/britain-huawei-5G.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egetting caught\u003c/a\u003e in the U.S.-China crossfire. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe U.S. insists Huawei equipment represents a national security threat. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut it’s hard for even American allies to turn down Huawei’s affordable prices and reach. It’s the global leader in telecom equipment, thanks in part to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-the-journal-calculated-huaweis-state-support-11577280830?mod=article_inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egenerous subsidies\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e from the Chinese government. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e This is one of the U.K.’s “biggest public breaks with Washington in decades,” writes Reuters.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you listen closely, you can hear the Sazeracs clinking. Americans \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-28/americans-will-inherit-764-billion-this-year-mostly-tax-free?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill inherit\u003c/a\u003e $764 billion this year, according to a new \u003ca href=\"https://www.hamiltonproject.org/papers/leveling_the_playing_field_between_inherited_income_and_income_from_work_through_an_inheritance_tax?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epaper\u003c/a\u003e by NYU law professor Lily Batchelder. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe paper estimates Americans will pay an average tax of 2.1% on that bounty. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat’s less than a seventh of what Americans pay in taxes on work and savings—an estimated 15.8%. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBatchelder thinks that reflects a broken system.\u003c/strong\u003e She wants the U.S. to ditch the loophole-happy \u003cem\u003eestate\u003c/em\u003e tax, which requires Father Alistair's estate to pay taxes on its gifts to heirs. Instead, Batchelder proposes an \u003cem\u003einheritance\u003c/em\u003e tax, which is levied on young Theodore Vanderfeller III and other ultrawealthy recipients. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Tax Policy Center estimates that a tax on inheritances over $500,000 would raise $1.4 trillion over the next 10 years. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eBatchelder is a former Obama adviser. The Dems are \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-07/democrats-are-finding-ways-to-tax-the-ultra-wealthy?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elooking for\u003c/a\u003e novel ways to tax the rich to fund progressive priorities.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTQxL3RyZWFzdXJ5X2RlcGFydG1lbnQuSlBHIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eAgnosticPreachersKid, Treasury Department WDC, CC BY 3.0\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe U.S. budget deficit will top $1 trillion this year, according to a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cbo.gov/publication/56020?mod=article_inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew report\u003c/a\u003e from the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office (CBO). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat that means: \u003c/strong\u003eThe government will spend $1.02 trillion more than it collects in 2020. The widening deficit \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/01/28/us-deficit-eclipse-1-trillion-2020-cbo-says-fiscal-imbalance-continues-widen/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis a result\u003c/a\u003e of the 2017 tax cuts and an increase in spending on federal programs.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe historical context: \u003c/strong\u003eWe haven’t seen deficits of this size during periods of low unemployment since World War II, CBO Director Phill Swagel \u003ca href=\"https://www.cbo.gov/publication/56052?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e. Public debt is projected to reach 98% of GDP by 2030—its highest percentage since 1946. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe good news: \u003c/strong\u003e“The economy is doing well,” Swagel stressed, thanks to strong job growth and consumer spending. The CBO projects GDP will expand at a “solid rate” of 2.2% in 2020. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhich makes the current deficit more concerning; after all, deficits are supposed to \u003cem\u003eshrink\u003c/em\u003e in a strong economy. Fed Chair Jerome Powell, who we’ll hear from later today, \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2019/11/13/interest-rates-powell-tells-congress-federal-debt-unsustainable/2582302001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid last year\u003c/a\u003e “the federal budget is on an unsustainable path.” \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!--
